definitions.definition: Containing the maximum possible amount that can fit in the space available.
definitions.example: The jugs were full to the point of overflowing.
Our book gives full treatment to the subject of angling.
She had tattoos the full length of her arms.   He was prosecuted to the full extent of the law.

definitions.definition: Having eaten to satisfaction, having a "full" stomach; replete.
definitions.example: "I'm full," he said, pushing back from the table.
I prefer my pizzas full of toppings.
full lips; a full face; a full figure

definitions.definition: Of a garment, of a size that is ample, wide, or having ample folds or pleats to be comfortable.
definitions.example: a full pleated skirt;   She needed her full clothing during her pregnancy.

definitions.definition: Having the mind filled with ideas; stocked with knowledge; stored with information.
Having the attention, thoughts, etc., absorbed in any matter, and the feelings more or less excited by it.
definitions.example: She's full of her latest project.

definitions.definition: (postnominal) Said of the three cards of the same rank in a full house.
definitions.example: I'll beat him with my kings full! = three kings and two unspecified cards of the same rank.

definitions.definition: A convex, rounded or grooved tool, used by blacksmiths for shaping metal.
A groove made by such a tool (in the blade of a sword etc.).
To form a groove or channel in, by a fuller or set hammer.
